summary: Silvia Duran was connected to Lee Harvey Oswald during his visits to the Cuban embassy in Mexico City in September 1963. The documents suggest that she was likely an employee or contact at the Cuban embassy. Her significance arises from her interactions with Oswald prior to the Kennedy assassination. The documents mention her in the context of CIA investigations and reviews of Oswald's activities in Mexico City. One document refers to an interview of David Atlee Phillips regarding CIA activities in Mexico, particularly concerning Cuban operations and knowledge of Oswald and Silvia Duran. Another document summarizes a review of tapes, transcripts, and cables related to Lee Harvey Oswald's activities in Mexico City prior to the Kennedy assassination.
significance: Silvia Duran's significance in the JFK assassination context stems from her interactions with Lee Harvey Oswald at the Cuban embassy in Mexico City shortly before the assassination. These interactions were of interest to the CIA and were investigated as part of the broader inquiry into Oswald's activities and potential connections.
